result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Thigpen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more charges in this case, Joseph Thigpen was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Angela Nelson from WCS present.  State concurs with the report/treatment plan.  Defense also concurs with the report/treatment plan.  Court finds the treatment plan for conditional release is appropriate.  Deft is committed to the Dept of Health Services for a period of 6years with the provisions/conditions which are contained in the report.  Dept is authorized to transfer placement to other counties if in accordance with law and if benefits the treatment of the deft.  Local law enforcement needs to be notified of whatever county he resides in.  Credit for 557 days.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Hrg set for 8/24/17 @ 11am on conditional release.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  John Jansen - Dept of Human Services also present.  As of today - deft is now #21 on the list for admissions; he was previously #29.  He has been waiting since 3/1/16 for transport to Mendota.  Discussion ensues.  Court adjourns the hrg to allow Atty Terry Rose to contact personnel at the Veterans Hospital to see how comfortable they may be with the court releasing the deft on a signature bond with the condition that he report to the Veterans Hospital for treatment/medication.  Hrg to be continued on 5/5/16 @ 10am.

records.addlTxt: Of Commitment for Treatment (Form CR-206).

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Terry Rose.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Testimony of Dr. John Pankiewicz heard by phone.  Upon completion of testimony the Court found the defendant to be not competent at this time but is lkely to regain competency.  Def. is committed to the Mental Health Board for a period of one year or until competency is restored.  Medication order is necessary.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Terry Rose.  Report has now been received from Dr. Pankiewicz; report states the deft is not competent to proceed at this time.  State stipulates to the findings in the report.  Defense stipulates to the report.  Deft disagrees with the findings in report.  Evidentiary hrg set for 3/1/16 @ 11am.
